title: Jennifer Aniston uses intermittent fasting to stay in shape at 50
text:
Jennifer is in great shape (Picture: Getty)

Jennifer Aniston has revealed she uses the 16:8 fasting diet to stay in shape.

The 50-year-old is known for loving a good workout, but now she has dished the secrets to her eating plan – and it involves an eight-hour window.

Jennifer is a fan of 16:8 intermittent fasting – where you fast for 16 hours and limit your meals to your chosen eight-hour window.

Speaking to Radio Times, the Friends actress said: ‘I do intermittent fasting, so no food in the morning.

‘I noticed a big difference in going without solid food for 16 hours.’

Reese looks to Jennifer for wellness advice (Picture: Lester Cohen/Getty Images For ELLE)

Intermittent fasting is said to assist weight loss, control blood sugar levels and boost brain function.

However, nutritious food is still necessary during the eight-hour window, as eating junk food or over-eating can negate the positive effects.

Jennifer likes to stay in bed until 9am – well for some – and even when she’s not fasting, she starts her day with a celery juice, followed by meditation and a workout.

Plus, the star works out five times a week… so yeah, intermittent fasting just won’t cut it alone.

The full interview can be seen in Radio Times (Picture: RADIO TIMES)

Her The Morning Show co-star Reese Witherspoon is also a gym bunny, working out up to six times a week and saying: ‘I just have a green juice and a coffee in the morning.

‘Jen knows so much about health and fitness that I always defer to her. She’s great at wellbeing advice.’

Perhaps we’ll be getting some wellbeing advice on social media, now that Jen has joined Instagram.

The actress – whose Friends character Rachel Green has been deemed the show’s worst employee – managed to crash the platform as she racked up 6.9 million followers in less than 24 hours.

Jennifer, who has only uploaded four posts so far, now has a whopping 15.5 million followers – 10 million more than bestie Courteney Cox.

This girl has clout.

Jennifer and Reese’s interview can be read in Radio Times, out today.
